resources.string: Welcome to the Astro Quiz!\nAre you up for the challenge?
Answer all of the questions below, keep scrolling until you reach the end of the quiz. Do you have what it takes to answer all of them correctly?
Which of the following statements is true?
A meteor, known colloquially as a \"shooting star\" or \"falling star\", is the visible passage of a glowing meteoroid, micrometeoroid, comet or asteroid through Earth\'s atmosphere.
A asteroid is the part of a meteor that reaches the surface of the Earth.
A meteorite is a portion of a meteoroid or asteroid that survives its passage through the atmosphere and hits the ground without being destroyed.
Is the Moon the only natural satellite of Earth?
Which planet in our solar system has rings around it?
Which of the following are stars?
Which star has a fixed apparent location on the night sky in the northern hemisphere?
